functionDecorators.name: deleteElementsAfterInclusive
functionDecorators.description: Removes all objects after and including a given index. Also allows setting the global metadata field.

parameterDecorators.name: _globalMetadata
parameterDecorators.description: New global metadata for the container.

functionDecorators.name: deleteElementsAfterInclusive
functionDecorators.description: Removes all objects after and including a given index.

functionDecorators.name: get
functionDecorators.description: Retrieves an object from the container.

parameterDecorators.name: _index
parameterDecorators.description: Index of the particular object to access.

functionDecorators.name: getGlobalMetadata
functionDecorators.description: Retrieves the container's global metadata field.

functionDecorators.name: length
functionDecorators.description: Retrieves the number of objects stored in the container.

returnDecorators.description: Number of objects in the container.

functionDecorators.name: push
functionDecorators.description: Pushes an object into the container. Function allows setting the global metadata since we'll need to touch the "length" storage slot anyway, which also contains the global metadata (it's an optimization).

parameterDecorators.name: _object
parameterDecorators.description: A 32 byte value to insert into the container.

parameterDecorators.name: _globalMetadata
parameterDecorators.description: New global metadata for the container.

functionDecorators.name: push
functionDecorators.description: Pushes an object into the container.

parameterDecorators.name: _object
parameterDecorators.description: A 32 byte value to insert into the container.

functionDecorators.name: resolve
functionDecorators.description: Resolves the address associated with a given name.

parameterDecorators.name: _name
parameterDecorators.description: Name to resolve an address for.

returnDecorators.description: Address associated with the given name.

functionDecorators.name: setGlobalMetadata
functionDecorators.description: Sets the container's global metadata field. We're using `bytes27` here because we use five bytes to maintain the length of the underlying data structure, meaning we have an extra 27 bytes to store arbitrary data.
